entry.title: Exercise 1
entry.content:
Exercise 1.2

(/ (+ 5 4 (- 2 (- 3 (+ 6 (/ 4 5))))) (* (- 6 2) (- 2 7))

Exercise 1.3

(define (square x)(* x x))

(define (sum_square x y) (+ (square x) (square y)))

(define (sqsumlargest x y z)
    (cond 
        ((and (>= y x) (>= z x)) (sum_square y z))
        ((and (>= x y) (>= z y)) (sum_square x z))
        ((and (>= x z) (>= y z)) (sum_square x y))
    )
)

Exercise 1.4

(define (abs_plus x y)
    ((if (> b 0) + -) a b)
)
  • Return the sum of a and b where (a + b), if _b_is breater than 0,
  • Otherwise return the diffence between a and b where (a - b).
    (a + | b |) : which means A plus the absolute of B

Exercise 1.5

-Applicative-order (evaluate the argument sub-expressions first)
The evaluation of (test 0 (p)) never terminates

(test 0 (p))

(test 0 (p))

(test 0 (p))
...

-Normal-order (Do not touch the argument sub-expression, but replace the call (test 0 (p)) first )

(test 0 (p)
    (if (= 0 0) 0 (p))
)

# return 0 in the end
